item.title: Jen add a quote by Kathryn Stockett
item.description: "You is kind. You is smart. You is important." -- Kathryn Stockett

item.title: Jen add a quote by Wally Lamb
item.description: "I am not a smart man, particularly, but one day, at long last, I stumbled from the dark woods of my own, and my family's, and my country's past, holding in my hands these truths: that love grows from the rich loam of forgiveness; that mongrels make good dogs; that the evidence of God exists in the roundness of things. This much, at least, I've figured out. I know this much is true." -- Wally Lamb

item.title: Jen add a quote by Wally Lamb
item.description: "Look, don't just stare at the pages," I used to tell my students. "Become the characters. Live inside the book." -- Wally Lamb

item.title: Jen add a quote by Wally Lamb
item.description: "With destruction comes renovation." -- Wally Lamb

item.title: Jen add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer
item.description: "That's what I love about reading: one tiny thing will interest you in a book, and that tiny thing will lead you to another book, and another bit there will lead you onto a third book. It's geometrically progressive - all with no end in sight, and for no other reason than sheer enjoyment." -- Mary Ann Shaffer

item.title: Jen add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer
item.description: "Men are more interesting in books than they are in real life." -- Mary Ann Shaffer

item.title: Jen add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer
item.description: "Have you ever noticed that when your mind is awakened or drawn to someone new, that person's name suddenly pops up everywhere you go? My friend Sophie calls it coincidence, and Mr. Simpless, my parson friend, calls it Grace. He thinks that if one cares deeply about someone or something new one throws a kind of energy out into the world, and "fruitfulness" is drawn in. " -- Mary Ann Shaffer

item.title: Jen add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer
item.description: "Life goes on." What nonsense, I thought, of course it doesn't. It's death that goes on." -- Mary Ann Shaffer

item.title: Jen add a quote by Patricia Gaffney
item.description: "I hate jealousy. At least it's its own punishment; it makes me feel like hell." -- Patricia Gaffney

item.title: Jen add a quote by Chris Cleave
item.description: "We must see all scars as beauty. Okay? This will be our secret. Because take it from me, a scar does not form on the dying. A scar means, 'I survived'." -- Chris Cleave

item.title: Jen add a quote by Chris Cleave
item.description: "I could not stop talking because now I had started my story, it wanted to be finished. We cannot choose where to start and stop. Our stories are the tellers of us. " -- Chris Cleave

item.title: Jen add a quote by Chris Cleave
item.description: "To be well in your mind you have first to be free." -- Chris Cleave

item.title: Jen add a quote by Chris Cleave
item.description: "Life is extremely short and you cannot dance to current affairs." -- Chris Cleave

item.title: Jen add a quote by Chris Cleave
item.description: "Sad words are just another beauty. A sad story means, this storyteller is alive. The next thing you know something fine will happen to her, something marvelous, and then she will turn around and smile." -- Chris Cleave

item.title: Jen add a quote by Chris Cleave
item.description: "Wouldn't that be funny, if the oil rebels were playing U2 in their jungle camps, and the government soldiers were playing U2 in their trucks. I think everyone was killing everyone else and listening to the same music... That is a good trick about this world, Sarah. No one likes each other, but everyone likes U2." -- Chris Cleave

item.title: Jen add a quote by Chris Cleave
item.description: "On our honeymoon we talked and talked. We stayed in a beachfront villa, and we drank rum and lemonade and talked so much that I never even noticed what color the sea was. Whenever I need to stop and remind myself how much I once loved Andrew, I only need to think about this. That the ocean covers seven tenths of the earth's surface, and yet my husband could make me not notice it." -- Chris Cleave

item.title: Jen add a quote by Meg Wolitzer
item.description: "You stayed around your children as long as you could, inhaling the ambient gold shavings of their childhood, and at the last minute you tried to see them off into life and hoped that the little piece of time you’d given them was enough to prevent them from one day feeling lonely and afraid and hopeless. You wouldn’t know the outcome for a long time." -- Meg Wolitzer

item.title: Jen add a quote by Eric Roth
item.description: "For what it’s worth: it’s never too late or, in my case, too early to be whoever you want to be. There’s no time limit, stop whenever you want. You can change or stay the same, there are no rules to this thing. We can make the best or the worst of it. I hope you make the best of it. And I hope you see things that startle you. I hope you feel things you never felt before. I hope you meet people with a different point of view. I hope you live a life you’re proud of. If you find that you’re not, I hope you have the courage to start all over again." -- Eric Roth

item.title: Jen add a quote by Garth Stein
item.description: "There is no dishonor in losing the race. There is only dishonor in not racing because you are afraid to lose." -- Garth Stein

item.title: Jen add a quote by Garth Stein
item.description: "He died that day because his body had served its purpose. His soul had done what it came to do, learned what it came to learn, and then was free to leave." -- Garth Stein

item.title: Jen add a quote by Garth Stein
item.description: "The true hero is flawed. The true test of a champion is not whether he can triumph, but whether he can overcome obstacles - preferably of his own making - in order to triumph." -- Garth Stein

item.title: Jen add a quote by Garth Stein
item.description: "To live every day as if it had been stolen from death, that is how I would like to live. To feel the joy of life, as Eve felt the joy of life. To separate oneself from the burden, the angst, the anguish that we all encounter every day. To say I am alive, I am wonderful, I am. I am. That is something to aspire to." -- Garth Stein

item.title: Jen add a quote by Garth Stein
item.description: "That which is around me does not affect my mood; my mood affects that which is around me." -- Garth Stein

item.title: Jen add a quote by Garth Stein
item.description: "To separate oneself from the burden, the angst, the anguish that we all encounter everyday. To say I am alive, I am wonderful, I am. I am. That is something to aspire to." -- Garth Stein

item.title: Jen add a quote by Garth Stein
item.description: "The car goes where the eyes go." -- Garth Stein

item.title: Jen add a quote by Garth Stein
item.description: "[T]he race is long - to finish first, first you must finish." -- Garth Stein

item.title: Jen add a quote by Garth Stein
item.description: "This is a rule of racing: No race has ever been won in the first corner; many have been lost there." -- Garth Stein

item.title: Jen add a quote by Garth Stein
item.description: "When I return to the world, I will be a man. I will walk among you. I will lick my lips with my small, dexterous tongue. I will shake hands with other men, grasping firmly with my opposable thumbs. And I will teach all people that I know. And when I see a man or a woman or a child in trouble, I will extend my hand, both metaphorically and physically. I will offer my hand. To him. To her. To you. To the world. I will be a good citizen, a good partner in the endeaver of life that we all share." -- Garth Stein

item.title: Jen add a quote by Garth Stein
item.description: "That which we manifest is before us." -- Garth Stein

item.title: Jen add a quote by Garth Stein
item.description: "People are always worried about what's happening next. They often find it difficult to stand still, to occupy the now without worrying about the future. People are generally not satisfied with what they have; they are very concerned with what they are going to have." -- Garth Stein
